title: I hope more pro players pick non meta champs and utterly fail with them
body:
Garen changes FINALLY pushed forward to PBE
If more champs failed in games what are considered rurrly rurrly important they may actually remember they exist

replies.body:
the community tells riot, the cooldown is absurd pretty much since his rework a few month before season 3.

some chinese pro picks him, utterly fails with him, and theyre like "oh hey. his ult cooldown might be too long". dont get me wrong, im happy about the buff, but that attitude of only working on champs when theyre picked in pro play leads to a vicious cycle, of unpopular champs never being picked, because they need work, and theyre never/rarely worked on, because theyre never picked.

> [{quoted}](name=Critmaster Garen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IKZak4zs,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-27T21:40:41.676+0000)
>
> the community tells riot, the cooldown is absurd pretty much since his rework a few month before season 3.
> 
> some chinese pro picks him, utterly fails with him, and theyre like "oh hey. his ult cooldown might be too long". dont get me wrong, im happy about the buff, but that attitude of only working on champs when theyre picked in pro play leads to a vicious cycle, of unpopular champs never being picked, because they need work, and theyre never/rarely worked on, because theyre never picked.

The game has to be balanced on a certain level, when pro play is a factor that's always gonna be the level they balance for.

> [{quoted}](name=RYN Flux,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IKZak4zs,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-03-27T21:52:09.285+0000)
>
> The game has to be balanced on a certain level, when pro play is a factor that's always gonna be the level they balance for.

Balancing for professional play and ONLY taking professional play into consideration are two different things.
Garen is a good example of that; 
Community says his ult is to long: Riot plugs their ears and yells "LALALALALALA"
Pro says his ult is to long: Riot rushes to fix what they now see is a problem

Its an attitude which fosters terrible balance and elitism.

They're almost the exact same thing.. The community complains about a lot of stuff (Kat, Yi, Riven, LeBlanc, Sion, Sejuani, the list goes on and on) and if they "balanced" all of them based on what the community thought was right the game would be mayhem.
I get what you're saying, but they can't please everyone.

but the cooldown on garens ult was pretty obviously stupid. there is a lot of stuff that is debatable, but looking at his kit compared to other ults with similar cooldowns. yea, no.

> The community complains about a lot of stuff (Kat, Yi, Riven, LeBlanc, Sion, Sejuani, the list goes on and on)

**They nerfed Kata** (Cooldown to 90 from 60).
**They nerfed Yi** (%Damage on E reduced to 10 from 9-15 or something like that).
**They nerfed Riven** (Damage on her Q, Shield duration reduced to 1.5 from 3 seconds).
**They nerfed LeBlanc** (Removed her silence).
**They nerfed Sion** (E mana cost increased. Q damage vs. monsters reduced, E damage with a minion reduced).
**They nerfed Sejuani** (W damage reduced, R movement speed slow reduced).

Try again.

No, but riot can acknowledge problems. 
If a majority of the community says something - like lee sin is a problem, zed is broken, and nidalee needs many nerfs - then chances are they NEED to be looked at.

Zed and nidalee have like an 80% pick rate in LCS, too.

in the end the problem isnt who dictates it
pros can cry about whatever they want and it wont be ballanced accordingly 

the problem is lack of input 
pro games are rare and obserwed by riot, they provide good quality feedback 

so riot can ballance the game around it since its proven to be reliable estimate of how champion does in game 

but there is no other place to actualy get the same input 
pbe is just for testing for bugs, nobody realy plays seriousl there 
while solo q is full of trolls afks, and other problems riot needs to fix 

since we lack an actual testing grounds we face 2 things 
-game is ballanced around lcs since its the best input riot can get
-if riot ballances something that isnt in the lcs they base themselves on how it feels to play at their office, so many problems they try to fix backfires 


so our champions are never realy ballanced since ballance in lol is dynamic, and there is no place to get enough data to actualy ballance all that stuff

except that both kat and yi got nerfed due to what they did in solo/lower elos,both of them got nerfed(yi quite a while ago) without having much competitive presence(btw shaco is on that list too),le blanc is an exceptionally toxic champion,she shouldn't even be viable(she has poppy levels of counterplay,hell,even less,at least poppy can be ganked) and is just clear favoritism because she is flashy(it's disgusting really),sion and sejuani(and amumu) you might have a point about,riven I'm not too sure about.

Honestly it's clear riot does a lot of winrate balancing(as in,if winrate is >49%,the champ is fine,no matter if both competitive players and pub players(generally visible through popularity) think it to be utterly useless),and it's pretty horrible right now,worst is people are so stupid they would actually argue for it,do you seriously want to tell me you want an ashe on your team? you know,the adc with no damage,no mobility,no burst,no dueling power who has a bunch of slows and an ult which can be dodged(walking/mobility) or outright removed with mikaels,oh,and blackshielded,who also has plenty of horrible matchups in bot lane,yes,I'm sure everyone is just yelling at their teammates "GO ASHE 51% WINRATE ITS OP".

Maybe if the community wasn't so stupid and wouldn't be so obsessed with this stupid number riot would actually stop balancing around it.

Out of like 130~ champs? That means on average you have a pool of like 10 champs available. 1 out of those 10 is always gonna be the favorite. We're not seeing Garen enough? Who the hell cares? We never see Miss Fortune and nobody says a word, do you know why? Because she was never a faceroll champion that is now useless due to meta. People just want their cheese picks back, and there's a reason they're gone to begin with.

don't exaggerate it,team comps and playstles exists,so generally 3(to 5) are the favorites,and they are considered op,and generally get nerfed sooner or later.

>We're not seeing Garen enough? Who the hell cares?

Garen is just an example,sure,the top picks rotate(from lee to j4 to kha and back(kappa),at least we have some tanks now) and that's the way it should be,but you have some champions sitting on the bench with 0 competitive play,completely ignored by riot,left to rot,possibly for years(lux is another great example of that,ashe is another),now you see some people play/enjoy those champions,do you know how great it feels to keep getting ignored when your favorite champion has been trash for more than a year? then you open to see changes on pbe and see a bunch of ahri buffs,cause apparently she hasn't made the meta her bitch for long enough?
For every champion you can find someone who mains him(apparently even for garen),so a lot of people care about these forsaken champions.

>We never see Miss Fortune and nobody says a word, do you know why? Because she was never a faceroll champion that is now useless due to meta. People just want their cheese picks back, and there's a reason they're gone to begin with.

People don't complain about Miss fortune because they basically have given up hope,or these threads just don't get upvoted(yeah probably this option),you know what,if someone picked miss fortune,failed on it,and she got buffed on pbe,we would probably see the exact same thread about her.

Essentially saying that Riot needs to not just look into that, but listen to the (sarcasm) valuable input of the "community".

Yes, I do disagree, just because a champion doesn't see professional play doesn't mean they should just automatically get a buff. You know why Lux isn't seeing pro level play? Because none of the team comps call for her skill set. That simple. Katarina barely saw pro play until the end of this split, nobody was screaming for buffs there. There are certain strategies for winning games that are completely different than the way you and I play the game. 

There's a reason we aren't the balance team at Riot.. because it isn't our job. Because we don't have all the facts on it like they do. They're not out to screw everyone over, because why would that make sense?

And I think you are too quick to completely dismiss it in it's entirety,I agree that garen probably didn't get buffed because he did poorly in that game,I also don't think riot needs a champion to actively fail competitively to buff it(though actually,it probably helps move it up the ladder),but the core notion,that some champions don't see competitive play and continue getting ignored I definitely agree with.

>Either way, that's neither here nor there, the point still stands that popular champs are always going to **require** for the team to be on top of them and keeping them in line. What would be the point of Lux getting worked on while Ahri was still going on rampages?

The thing is,the reason why ahri keeps on getting ramapages is because she was buffed over dfg removal,then to make things even worse(to make it clear,she would still be REALLY strong even without it) they released lucent echo which is tailored for her,but the most important thing is: even if ahri was left completely untouched after the removal of dfg she would still be a hell lot stronger than lux,yes still she got compensated,and lux ignored,again(lux and ahri are just examples here,meanwhile kassadin has buffs on pbe,then probably will be op again,then will get nerfed,then buffed,then the cycle of "everything is about kassadin,no matter how toxic he is" continues).

>Every champ will have their time, they're obv not just gonna drop support from certain champs, but if they're a garbage can champ that has no place in the current meta (Talking to you Garen) then they're gonna be waiting til all of the viable options are taken care of.

Hm, how does Mao counter Garen? Is it just the high base armor, or does some aspect of Mao's kit make him good vs. Garen?

(Sorry for the slight derail, just curious)

It's mostly that Mao makes it incredibly hard for Garen to kill him. Not to mention Mao can get pretty strong just by building tanky so he can deal more damage over time. Garen kind of requires to get ahead or else you are forced into full Tank Garen where you will be useless. Plus Mao can peel for his team against Garen very easily so its more of a bad match-up rather then like a full on counter. Its possible for Garen to win this lane.... by being in other lanes more often then his own.

Tree man's innate tankyness, along with his cc and ultimate make Garen's just of killing/bullying him really hard. Your ult is useless because of how little it will do due to moakai's % damage reduction, and his healing.

A good moa won't let you kill him, unless you get a good gank off. 

In teamfights, he stops you from touching his carries.

Even if Garen did manage to get past him, Janna could say "lol no" and click r. It was just a bad time to pick Garen.

If they wanted a a lane bully, Darius honestly would have been better in theory, because moakai cannot reduce the true damage, and he would have a slightly easier time reaching an enemy mvp due to his E, but even then, Darius suffers from unreliability right now (Buffs will fix that coming next patch), and then it really still would be hard, because janna and moakai would still have mass peel, but darius funnily enough is better for peeling his carries than Garen.

If you have to go full tank as Garen, Darius would be better, because his ult allows him to do damage without building damage.

As said above, this is really just theory crafting, as Darius is weak atm due to all of his innate weaknesses, and his ult only being half finished (They took a core mechanic out of it, and never compensated). He is getting alot of his power back next patch, and thus, he WOULD be a better pick if that game took place on the future patch (Theoretically).

I bring Darius up because while other lane bullies might be more meta, or more balanced (Strong numbers, good kits), they would still struggle against moakai, because he is very hard to push out of lane. In a world where Darius is not underpowered/completed, he would be the best pick to bully moakai, and is not expected to initiate, thus Janna would not hurt him as bad.
On top of that, he was initiating at completely inappropriate times and taking far too long to get out.

Personally I play a lot of Garen and while it would be nice to have a shorter cd on ult, I never really found it that detrimental to his play style.  I'd much rather have kept the old cd but had the damage changed to true damage or just gave it back the 1.4 total attack ratio personally. 

Definitely a welcome change, but not something I see as game breaking. So I can kind of see why they didn't touch / think about it.
